settings.heading: FAQs
settings.copy: Your most common questions answered

settings.question: Can I track my order?
settings.answer: As soon as your order has been fulfilled, you will get a shipping notification with tracking details. If you have not received a tracking link, email team@mybushbalm.com and we will send it to you.

settings.question: Do you ship orders to the UK & EU?
settings.answer: Yes, we ship to the UK & EU. To get your order to you, we’ve partnered with Passport Shipping and they will be the Seller for all orders to the UK for orders under £135 and orders to the EU for orders €150 and Under.

settings.question: What are your shipping rates?
settings.answer: Depends on what you order! We have very fair shipping rates across Canada and the United States.

settings.question: What is the shipping timeline?
settings.answer: Once you place your order it may take up to 2 business days for it to be fulfilled at our warehouse. From there, your order will be shipped out and will typically take 5-7 business days with our Standard Shipping option and 1-3 business days for our Express Shipping option for your order to arrive at your designated shipping destination. This timeline is not guaranteed as some packages arrive earlier or later depending on your location.

settings.title: Does Bushbalm come discreetly packaged?
settings.copy: Our package are delivered in standard shipping boxes with no logos but the shipping label will have our name and address written on it.

settings.title: Can I apply deodorant after applying the oil?
settings.copy: Yes of course. Just ensure the oil has been absorbed fully before applying your deodorant. We suggest you wait anywhere from 30 seconds to 3 minutes.

settings.title: What is the shelf life?
settings.copy: All of our oils have a 6 month shelf life once the have opened, and 12 months unopened. This all depends on the conditions though. If you are keeping Bushbalm oils in a light filled room, the sun will likely speed up the life of the oil.

settings.title: Exfoliating Scrubs
settings.copy: Formulated with sugar and a hydrating blend of mixed oils that brightens and hydrates skin.

settings.title: Soothing Oils
settings.copy: Formulated with natural ingredients to help improve the look of dark spots, ingrown hairs, razor burn and more.

settings.title: Moisturizers
settings.copy: Formulated with naturally derived ingredients to leave your skin feeling soft and hydrated.

settings.title: Tools & Accessories
settings.copy: Ranging from our signature trimmer to various exfoliating tools, such as the Nordic Dry Brush and Body Rock.

settings.heading: Product Guide
settings.copy: Theses guides give you all the instructions and best practices for all Bushbalm products.

settings.title: Step 1 | Prep
settings.copy: Prior to showering begin your routine by dry brushing. Follow your dry brush by hopping in the showering and cleaning the skin with our Nourishing Body Wash.

settings.title: Step 2 | Exfoliate
settings.copy: While in the shower grab your favorite Bushbalm scrub and exfoliate away dead skin cells and rejuvenate skin.

settings.title: Step 3 | Soothe
settings.copy: Use your daily soothing oil to soften the skin and hair. Our top selling oils help reduce the appearance of ingrown hairs, dark spots, razor burn and more.

settings.title: Step 4 | Moisturize
settings.copy: As a final step you should lock in all the moisture you can. Grab our firming body cream and apply it where you need an extra lift.

settings.heading: Routine Guide
settings.copy: The skincare everywhere routine is designed to leave you with smooth skin, head to toe and front to back.

settings.title: Jojoba Oil
settings.copy: Rich in fatty acids and packed with Vitamin E, A and D, Jojoba Oil soothes the skin and relieves irritation and discomfort.

settings.title: Tea Tree Oil
settings.copy: Packed with antibacterial, anti-inflammatory, antiviral, and anti-fungal properties, tea tree provides a soothing sensation to calm redness, swelling and inflammation.

settings.title: Copaiba Oil
settings.copy: Infused with Beta-Caryophyllene, Copaiba is a natural anti-inflammatory agent that will soothe and heal skin irritations.

settings.title: Grapeseed Oil
settings.copy: High in vitamin E and phenolic antioxidants, Grape seed Oil protects and preserves the skin's soft and supple appearance.

settings.heading: Ingredients & Information
settings.copy: We formulate all of our products with high quality, naturally derived ingredients.

settings.question: Why these ingredients?
settings.answer: Our choice in ingredients goes back to our belief that you should have access to naturally or naturally derived skincare options.

settings.question: Are these ingredients safe?
settings.answer: We formulate our products to be safe for your most sensitive areas. Always spot check for allergies and ask your physician if required.

settings.question: What is Bushbalm?
settings.answer: Bushbalm is a skincare company that strives to be the #1 natural product line for your bikini line and underarms. The products are formulated to prevent ingrown hairs, soothe redness, relieve irritation and soften the appearance of dark spots.

settings.question: Is Bushbalm cruelty free?
settings.answer: Yes, Bushbalm Skincare is cruelty free and vegan.

settings.title: Sugar
settings.copy: All of our exfoliating body scrubs are sugar based, because sugar gently exfoliates for soft, renewed, glowing skin.

settings.title: Natural Oils
settings.copy: Formulated with a blend of botanicals and essential oils to help skin feel soft and smooth.

settings.title: Aloe Vera
settings.copy: This beauty powerhouse has antioxidant properties, helps calms the skin, soothes redness, and provides mega-hydration for healthy-looking, glowing skin.

settings.title: Mango Seed Butter
settings.copy: A powerful moisturizing ingredient that has similar benefits to cocoa butter. The light, but silky rich ingredient melts in and visibly softens the skin, with no greasy after feel.

settings.question: Ingrown Hair & Razor Burn
settings.answer: An ingrown hair occurs when a shaved or tweezed hair grows back into the skin. It can cause inflammation, pain and tiny bumps in the area where the hair was removed. Ingrown hair is a common condition that results from hair removal.

settings.question: Dark Spots & Hyperpigmentation
settings.answer: Dark spots refer to patches of skin that are darker in color than the skin surrounding it. The contrast of light and dark patches creates the appearance of an uneven skin tone. This is a very common skin concern.

settings.question: Keratosis Pilaris
settings.answer: Keratosis Pilaris, also known as KP or "chicken skin", is a very common skin condition that creates small, hard bumps on the surface of the skin. These bumps form as a result of an excess buildup of keratin; keratin is a protein that is part of the skin and hair. Currently, it is unknown what causes this buildup in the first place. Nonetheless, the extra keratin clogs the pores and causes a bumpy rash to appear. KP is commonly found on the upper arms, thighs, chest, elbows, and the tush.

settings.question: Razor Burn & Bumps
settings.answer: Razor burn is the result of an unpleasant interaction between the razor blade, body hair, and skin. The symptoms of razor burn include; redness, irritation, discomfort, and stinging.

settings.heading: Skin Dictionary
settings.copy: Common skin concerns the beauty industry has often ignored. Find the definition and recommended routine.
